page.title: 13The New Forest
page.content: Our survey revealed that over 70% of the area consisted of forestland. It is part of the New Forest which includes Gritnam Wood, Whitley Wood and Park Ground Inclosure. Much of the land is ancient forest previously used for hunting. Deciduous trees are dominant chiefly oak, beech and birch. There are some small areas afforested with coniferous trees and there is also some heathland and marshland. There are 4 Inclosures, areas of forest which have been fenced off to protect trees from grazing animals such as deer and ponies. Much forest is managed by The Forestry Commission; and The Nature Conservancy Council based in Lyndhurst also seeks to preserve the natural habitats of the area in which wildlife and plantlife still thrive.
